text: in the last few years Japan has asked
for the Olympic Games to be postponed
for a year our Sports News reporter Alex
skeptic is with me now Alex what has
been said today well japan's Prime
Minister Shinzo Abe a had a meeting
conversation with Thomas Bach the IOC
president this morning about what to do
with the Olympics you might remember on
Sunday the IOC said they would take a
maximum of four weeks to make a final
decision to offer clarity in that course
a lot of complaints from athletes and
international National Olympic
Committee's it was taking too long so
they've had this meeting today and
Shinzo Abbey has asked for the games to
be postponed until the summer of next
year 2021 at the latest and given that
the torch relay was due to start this
week in Japan on Thursday it does make
sense for this decision to be made
sooner rather than later is the day
delay long enough because we're hearing
that it could be 18 months at least
before there is a vaccine does this
decision not really just you know kick
it further down the chain I think that's
guesswork at the moment we just don't
know clearly they think that it'll be
okay to stage the games in 2021
obviously if the virus isn't contained
then they'll have to make another
decision further down the road but at
the moment they're saying they want to
stage it in the summer of 2021 it's a
huge logistical challenge a huge
logistical problem to do that it's not
easy to postpone a games they haven't
cancelled it they always said that they
weren't going to cancel the games they
were going to put it on at some stage it
hasn't been easy to make that work I
expect there will be lots of challenges
logistical challenges ahead but as it
stands at the moment they're not going
to host it this year it's going to be in
2021 and this is the first time that an
Olympic Games has been postponed it has
been canceled before in wartime but it's
never been postponed this is very
difficult isn't it for athletes who are
training obviously everyone's you know
so many people are in lockdown now
around the world and yet if summer next
year doesn't feel feasible you know a
lot of work will potentially again be
wasted in terms of organization
sponsorship and the athletes training
program Absolut's been terrible for the
for the athletes and none of them have
spoken about how difficult it is the
uncertainty they can't train a lot of
them can't compete obviously and they
were talking about that would make an
unfair competition at the Olympics
because in some parts of the world
athletes can train
in others they can't and so if this goes
on of course that will cause further
problems down the road if athletes can't
train they're obviously hoping that
later this year into next year then they
will be able to train normally but as I
say that's guesswork with the Mon we'll
have to wait and see it skeptic thank
you very much indeed
